page.title: 13A DAY IN MY LIFE
page.content: Our house is a 19th century shooting lodge. It has got 11 bedrooms. We eat in the kitchen except when we have guests and then we eat in the dining room. My mother has two women who help clean the house but in the past this house had eleven indoor staff and eight gardeners. Now we have three days help in the garden each week. A hundred years ago all the staff had to walk to the village church one and a half miles away. The man who helps my father run the farm lives in the farm house which is called Sperry Barton. He and his wife have five children who go to school in Wiveliscombe by bus. The bus stops at each farm and at the end of the day the chuldren are dropped off at the end of the farm drive. They bike or walk home which is about a quarter of a mile.
